subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Denver Broncos promoted Brian Xanders to general manager. Xanders joined the Broncos as assistant general manager May 5 after several seasons in the Atlanta Falcons’ organization. He served as assistant general manager in Denver along with Jeff Goodman, whose father, Jim, was the Broncos’ vice president for football operations. The Goodmans were fired when Xanders was promoted. The team owner Pat Bowlen said he was confident Xanders and Josh McDaniels, the new coach, would lead the Broncos back to the playoffs after a three-year drought.
